text: Do we have a data structure for infinite vectors which are zero outside a dense subset of coordinates?

elements.text: Do we have a data structure for infinite vectors which are zero outside a dense subset of coordinates?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

There is something called an one hot vector where one element is stored.  infinite vectors are not possible due to you having to store the coordinates in RAM and some numbers exceed what you can store in memory.

The generalization of one hot vectors are sparse vectors.

You could also write your own vector that does what you want. "Dense" is kinda a vague concept.
